page.title: 04AGRICULTURE
page.content: { Agriculture}in {Blackrod}is mainly { {dairy farming.}Crops are grown,but only to feed the animals.{Barley and {oil seed rape }are grown for cattle food as well as grass for {hay and {silage.}The dairy cows kept are { {British Friesian and Friesian Holstein {cross.} Several farms have been sold over the last thirty years and the land used for building. There is one farm that breeds {beef {cattle.}This is the {Ridgefield {Pedigree Herd of Murray Greys.}They are a new breed,registered only in 1964. The animals are killed locally and sold by a local butcher. They also keep {8000 hens}which produce about{6250 eggs }per day which are packed on the farm. Farms here are between 150 and 200 acres. {
